PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Lawrence Walker, 614 Fifth Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958, pg. 5 with question: "Do you think that the city needs a fair housing ordinance?" answer reads: "I think that any modern city should have a fair housing ordinance. And I think it will be a good thing for Pittsburgh.  We are modern in everything else, such as building the Gateway Center and the Lower Hill Civic Arena and, therefore, we should be modern in housing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lawrence Walker wearing light colored fedora with dark band, moustache, plaid shirt and suit, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
